io.undertow.websockets.extensions

Class ExtensionByteBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.undertow.websockets.extensions.ExtensionByteBuffer

  • public class ExtensionByteBuffer
extends Object
    A wrapper for ByteBuffer class used in extensions context.

    An extension can transform buffer content beyond capacity.

    This wrapper is a mechanism to allocate extra buffers in an automatic way.

    ExtensionByteBuffer stores an internal array of Pooled buffer to manage an overflow of input ByteBuffer .

    Author:
    Lucas Ponce

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExtensionByteBuffer

        public ExtensionByteBuffer(WebSocketChannel channel,
                           ByteBuffer input,
                           int initPosition)
        Create a new ExtensionByteBuffer instance wrapping a ByteBuffer .

        It has access to WebSocketChannel instance to create extra buffer from AbstractFramedChannel.getBufferPool() .

        Parameters:
        channel - the WebSocketChannel used on this constructor
        input - the ByteBuffer to wrap on
        initPosition - the index in the ExtensionByteBuffer to start from

    • Method Detail

      • getInput

        public ByteBuffer getInput()
        Returns:
        the wrapped buffer

      • put

        public void put(byte value)
        Write the given byte into the wrapped ByteBuffer at the current position.

        It creates an extra buffer when current position reaches wrapped buffer or previously extra buffer maximum capacity.

        Parameters:
        value - the byte to be written

      • get

        public byte get(int position)
        Read the byte at the given position of wrapped buffer or extra buffers.
        Parameters:
        position - The position from which the byte will be read
        Returns:
        The byte at the given position
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - If position is negative or not smaller than the buffer's limit or extra buffer's limit

      • getFilled

        public int getFilled()
        Read the number of bytes filled on a put(byte) operation.
        Returns:
        the number of filled bytes in the buffer

      • hasExtra

        public boolean hasExtra()
        Check if this instance has not flushed extra buffers.
        Returns:
        true if this wrapped buffer has extra buffers

      • getExtra

        public int getExtra()
        Read number of extra buffers.
        Returns:
        the number of extra buffers

      • getExtraBuffer

        public ByteBuffer getExtraBuffer(int buffer)
        Get extra buffer at specified position.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the index of extra buffer
        Returns:
        the extra buffer at given position; null if no extra buffer or bad index specified

      • hasExtraRemaining

        public boolean hasExtraRemaining()
        Tells whether there are any elements between the current position and the limit of extra buffers.
        Returns:
        true if, and only if, there is at least one element remaining in this buffer

      • getExtraRemainingBuffer

        public ByteBuffer getExtraRemainingBuffer()
        Retrieve first extra buffer with remaining bytes.
        Returns:
        the first extra buffer with condition hasRemaining() == true; null if not extra buffers.

      • flipExtra

        public void flipExtra()
        Flip all extra buffers.

      • flushExtra

        public int flushExtra(ByteBuffer dst)
        Copy extra buffers content into ByteBuffer passed as parameter.

        When all content is flushed hasExtra() == false .

        Parameters:
        dst - target buffer to copy internal extra buffer content
        Returns:
        the number of bytes flushed

      • free

        public void free()
        Release extra pooled allocated for overflow content.
